name: Bit Crusher
description: This algorithm is an implementation of the disting mk4 algorithm named 'Bit Crusher'. It applies sample rate and bit depth reduction to deliberately introduce quantisation and aliasing artefacts. The ‘Bit reduce’ parameter sets the bit depth reduction, with two types available: Type I (discontinuous, using powers of 2 bits) and Type II (smooth variation via integer math division). Additionally, symmetric or asymmetric bit reduction can be chosen via the 'Symmetric' parameter. Asymmetric treats the whole signal range as one number to quantise, while symmetric processes positive and negative sections separately by flipping them positive, quantising, and flipping back. The ‘Reduction’ parameter allows different types of bit reduction for positive and negative signals (combinations of Type I/II or no reduction). The ‘Mangling’ parameter selects non-linear distortion effects via various bitwise modifications like bit swaps, rotations, or XOR operations with previous samples.
short_description: Sample rate and bit depth reduction

parameters.name: Width
parameters.description: The number of busses to process, starting from the Input. For example, for a stereo signal, set this to 2.
